Package tage.shapes

Class AnimatedSkeleton

java.lang.Object
tage.shapes.AnimatedSkeleton
public final class AnimatedSkeleton extends Object
A Skeleton describes the hierarchy and structure of any number of bones. These bones are to be used to modify the vertices of submesh for skeletal animation.

Within the submesh, each vertex has up to 3 bone parents and corresponding weights that determine the influence that up to 3 bones have on said vertex. This is kept track through the vertex having 3 bone indices that directly correlate to data stored in various buffers within the Skeleton class.

A vertex can be influenced by no bones, or up to 3 bones.

The game application should not need to interact with this class at all. Instead, it should use the loadAnimation() and playAnimation() tools in AnimationShape.
